body: summary potentially solves and by fixing a bug in ssl verification handling where was not properly respected when the method-level parameter was not explicitly provided . the environment variables or would incorrectly override the session's setting. problem the previous implementation had a logical flaw in that checked if the method-level parameter was or before applying environment variables, but it did not consider the session's setting first. this meant: - title: fix: respect user-defined proxy settings during redirects
body: summary this pr potentially fixes issue where it was reported that explicitly set proxy configurations were being overridden by environment proxy settings during http redirects. when users intentionally set to bypass environment-configured proxies, the redirect logic would ignore this and reapply environment proxy settings, causing unexpected behavior. problem previously, when following redirects, the method would always check environment variables , , etc. via when , even when the user had explicitly passed proxy settings including to bypass proxies . this caused the following issues: 1. explicit proxy bypass ignored : setting to bypass environment proxies would work for the initial request but fail on redirects 2. user intent overridden : environment variables would take precedence over explicit user configuration during redirect resolution 3. unexpected failures : requests would fail with proxy connection errors on redirects even when the user explicitly disabled proxy usage solution this pr introduces a flag that tracks whether the user has explicitly provided proxy configuration in the request call. the changes include: 1. flag propagation : the method detects when proxies are explicitly set including when set to and passes the flag through the redirect resolution chain 2. conditional trust env : the method now respects this flag and disables environment variable checking when the user has explicitly configured proxies 3. preserved user intent : user-defined proxy settings now take precedence over environment variables throughout the entire redirect chain changes - added parameter to and methods - modified to detect explicit proxy configuration and pass the flag - updated to conditionally disable when user explicitly set proxies - added to verify that explicit bypasses environment proxy settings even during redirects testing the new test case verifies the fix by: 1. setting an invalid proxy in the environment 2. making a request with explicit 3. following a redirect and confirming the request succeeds would fail if environment proxy was used backward compatibility this change is fully backward compatible: - existing behavior is preserved when proxies are not explicitly set - the flag continues to work as expected for environment-based proxy configuration - only affects cases where users explicitly provide proxy configuration, ensuring their intent is respected

title: feat: add urllib3 urlopen kwargs to httpadapter for custom url open arguments
body: summary this pr possibly solves and by introducing a new attribute to the class, enabling users to pass custom keyword arguments directly to urllib3's method. this enhancement provides greater flexibility for advanced use cases requiring specific urllib3 configurations that are not directly exposed by the requests api. changes made - added attribute : initialized as an empty dictionary in the method - updated method : modified to merge user-provided custom kwargs with default arguments before calling urllib3's - comprehensive test coverage : added 180+ lines of tests covering: - custom kwargs handling and merging behavior - object serialization pickling compatibility - integration with requests sessions - edge cases and error scenarios motivation users sometimes need to pass specific urllib3 configuration options that aren't exposed through the standard requests interface. this feature allows for: - fine-grained control over urllib3 behavior without monkey-patching - better support for advanced networking scenarios - improved extensibility of the httpadapter class files changed - +36, -13 lines - +180 lines testing all new functionality is covered by comprehensive unit tests that verify: - ✅ custom kwargs are properly passed through to urllib3 - ✅ default behavior remains unchanged when no custom kwargs are provided - ✅ httpadapter instances can be pickled/unpickled correctly - ✅ integration with sessions works as expected backward compatibility ✅ this change is fully backward compatible . the new attribute defaults to an empty dictionary, ensuring existing code continues to work without modification.

title: fix sphinx reference warnings by suppressing missing targets
body: description: this change updates docs/conf.py to suppress warnings for missing sphinx references. some references in the documentation do not correspond to existing targets, causing warnings during the build. by ignoring missing references, the build process completes cleanly without affecting the rendered documentation. changes: modified docs/conf.py to add suppress warnings = "ref.missing" . reasoning: suppressing these warnings is safe because the references are either external or intentionally omitted, and this prevents unnecessary noise in the build logs. testing: verified that make html completes without sphinx reference warnings. documentation renders as expected. notes: no other code or documentation files were modified.

title: don't create default sslcontext if ssl module isn't present
body: this pr is to address a recent regression in emscripten support for urllib3 we began unilaterally creating an sslcontext without consideration for python versions built without an ssl module. this is handled in urllib3 but missed in our usage of . this pr expands on the fix in 6716 by also evaluating both the presence of the module before creating and setting the default sslcontext.

title: fix: correct digest auth uri handling for semicolons in path 6990
body: 修复目标：fixes 6990） 问题原因：（url 被错误解析导致 authorization 中 uri 字段不完整） 修复方式：当请求 url 的 path 中包含分号（;）时，requests 在进行 http digest 认证时，authorization 头中的 uri 字段会丢失分号及其后面的内容，导致认证失败或行为异常。例如，访问如下 url 时：原有实现只保留了分号前的部分，uri 字段变成了 /path1;param1/part2?foo=bar，丢失了 ;param2。修复方案修改 src/requests/auth.py 中 httpdigestauth.build digest header 方法，拼接 path 和 params 字段，确保 uri 字段完整保留分号及其后的内容，符合 rfc 7616 要求。 影响范围：只影响 digest 认证场景，且仅在 url 路径中包含分号参数时有影响。兼容性良好，不影响其他认证方式和普通请求。 测试用例。新增测试用例（tests/test1.py），验证 uri 字段在包含分号参数时能正确生成。

title: security: update publish workflow to use instead of
body: use instead of with actions artifacts 🔒 this pull updates the publish workflow to use instead of when downloading artifacts that have been previously published in prior workflow steps. this is important because artifacts produced by github actions can be completely overwritten by other workflow runs if they use the same under very unique circumstances like passing the value to the download-artifact action to point to an entirely different workflow run - don't do that . to avoid potential toctou issues/vulnerabilities where an artifact might be replaced between upload and download, the new input allows you to download artifacts by their specific id rather than by name. this is safer but also helps lead to more deterministic workflow builds by referencing the artifact you wish to download by its exact id . this pr also hardens the workflow a bit by adding to the checkout step. --- i recently did some work to land these exact changes in the urllib3/urllib3 and wanted to contribute those same changes here as well!

title: address certificate loading regression
body: overview this pr is intended to address two distinct issues introduced with the default cert optimizations originally introduced in 2.32.0. while we continue to refine the settings considered when opting into our optimized context, we'll no longer use the new default if any custom cert values are supplied. this addresses the concurrency issues raised in 6726. the second piece of this will be ensuring that when opting out of the default sslcontext, we're still supplying to the default ca cert bundle correctly. this addresses the problems noticed in and 6730. considerations we're now duplicating a decent chunk of the logic from cert verify inside urllib3 request context but without our validation exceptions. that's a potential vector for behavioral shifts in the future. we could consolidate some of this behavior in one place but it's going to require constructing a dict and using on our in while setting in . i started writing that up but it feels clunky. this is probably going to be a tradeoff of risking drift like we have with session settings and binding the two behaviors together too tightly. testing i'd like to codify the issues we've encountered through the whole 2.32.x saga in tests to hopefully avoid this in the future. doing it cleanly without relying on external endpoints is proving to be a bit more involved than i'd like. i think we can harness some of the infrastructure added in 6662, but i haven't had a chance to really dig into that.

title: adding host details in proxy headers
body: issue: the connect request does not include host details when operating in a proxy environment. this can lead to failures in establishing a proper connection, as the host information is essential for routing the request through the proxy. code explanation: to address this issue, the following approach is used: check for host in proxy settings: if the proxy kwargs dictionary contains a host key, it indicates that host details are available. add host to proxy headers: these host details are added to the proxy headers dictionary under the host key. by doing so, the host information is explicitly included in the proxy headers, ensuring that the connect request incorporates the correct routing details. impact: including the host details in the proxy headers ensures that the connect request is properly formed and able to route through the proxy environment without any missing information. this resolves the issue and enhances connectivity reliability
